intro: Stenactis, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline environments. They have distinctive blue or violet flowers that are often surrounded by bracts resembling leaves. The leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of salt-excreting cells. Stenactis species are valued for their ornamental qualities and their ability to thrive in challenging coastal conditions.
